stream_context.summary: Stream focused on building Course 11 (working title "Oily Boily Bay")—a Bowser-owned oil-rig tower—while polishing UI elements and discussing recent global fixes and re-works across earlier courses.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is constructing Bowser’s corporate oil-rig tower in Course 11, including an entry path, strike-trigger grate, and boss platform where Mario will knock Bowser’s head off.
development_findings.quote: So this is what we were working on. We’re working on Bozo’s tower … you knock Bowser’s head off and you get another star.

development_findings.summary: Course 11 has been nicknamed “Oily Boily Bay”; Kaze intends to finalise its name once a better alliteration is found.
development_findings.quote: Oily Boily Bay is so goofy, but it works.

development_findings.summary: Multiple early levels have been completely re-worked since the demo: Course 1, Course 8 (ex-Course 2), deep-sea areas, and SMB3 retro sections now feature wider walls and new slide segments to improve camera and frame-rate.
development_findings.quote: Basically everything in this level has been completely reworked from the demo. It looks completely different. The framerate is higher.

development_findings.summary: New camera scheme: C-Left/Right now snap-rotate, D-Pad Left/Right hold for slow rotate, C-Up/Down and D-Pad Up/Down tilt, R centers view. Input-lag complaints drove the change.
development_findings.quote: We got new camera controls… Holding to rotate is gone.

development_findings.summary: Breath meter duration was shortened to prevent unrestricted underwater roaming unless the player finds a Koopa shell.
development_findings.quote: I wanted it shorter than vanilla … I don’t want the player to just feel free to roam around everywhere until they are on a Koopa shell.

development_findings.summary: Biobak’s revamped 6-segment health meter and circular breath meter were implemented; Kaze added a smooth scale-in/out animation and alpha-threshold fill logic.
development_findings.quote: You like how it scaled in, huh? That was so easy… Me and Biobak went through a lot of back and forth to get these colors exactly right.

development_findings.summary: Considering a new microcode that disables near-clipping to fix camera issues.
development_findings.quote: I’ve also been told about a new microcode today that we might want to use—the microcode allows you to disable near clipping.

development_findings.summary: Kaze plans a two-week coding sprint next month, likely to prototype split-screen multiplayer.
development_findings.quote: I get a two-week break from work at the end of next month, so I was thinking of just doing a bunch of large streams … making multiplayer in here.

development_findings.summary: Concept addition: three hidden musician Toads across overworlds; collecting them unlocks an overworld performance.
development_findings.quote: I had the crazy dream … if you collect all three, they’re gonna play a song for you in the overworld.

context_findings.summary: Kaze asserts strong design principles: prefers assembly before C, opposes meme inserts, values colour harmony, and wants high-quality long-term engagement.
context_findings.quote: This is a game, not a meme … I care a lot about making the colors work together in a way that is satisfying.

context_findings.summary: Balancing ROM-hack work with a full-time game-programmer job; comfortable with 70-hour weeks but acknowledges time constraints.
context_findings.quote: ROM making is not that lucrative, so I had to get a job … I don’t mind working 70-hour weeks.

context_findings.summary: Personal slice: Kaze and Zeina rescued an injured baby bird, reflecting their life outside dev; they later left to play board games with friends.
context_findings.quote: We rescued a little baby bird today … It was kind of nice to see him all happy and ready to go.

biobak.summary: Created new health-meter sprites, balanced hue so green is not brighter than blue, and provided Bowser-logo texture for the tower.
biobak.quote: Send the health sprites … Me and Biobak went through a lot of back and forth to get these colors exactly right.

zeina.summary: Actively participates in texture and prop brainstorming (e.g., Bowser flag, shell, plushies) and comments on level aesthetics; shares domestic anecdotes.

key_stories.title: Health & Breath UI Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Legacy meters looked dated and colour-imbalanced. Biobak supplied revised graphics while Kaze rewrote rendering for smooth transitions and N64 constraints.
key_stories.challenge: Old meters were visually dull, and green segments appeared brighter than blue.
key_stories.process: Biobak iterated on sprite sheets; Kaze converted them to IA16, added scale-in animation and alpha-threshold radial fill; solved compile bugs and matrix pops.
key_stories.outcome: Final meters now pop smoothly, respect colour parity, and display correctly on real N64 hardware.
key_stories.key_quote: You like how it scaled in, huh? That was so easy … it looks so cool now.

key_stories.title: Camera Control Re-Design
key_stories.summary: Player feedback flagged sluggish rotation; Kaze redesigned the scheme to remove hold-to-rotate lag and added D-Pad fine-control.
key_stories.challenge: Original camera had input lag and slow rotation speed.
key_stories.process: Mapped C-buttons to instant rotation, D-Pad to continuous slow rotate, added R re-center; tested in reworked courses.
key_stories.outcome: More responsive camera expected to improve playability.
key_stories.key_quote: We were complaining because of the slow control on the C button that there was too much input lag.

key_stories.title: Course 11—Bowser’s Oil-Rig Tower
key_stories.summary: Designing a new industrial level that merges a corporate office façade with hazardous oil-rig mechanics and a strike-breaking boss encounter.
key_stories.challenge: Need an aesthetic that feels Bowser-owned but fits game’s colour palette and N64 limitations.
key_stories.process: Iterated textures (black/red, neon rejected), placed Bowser emblem, planned grate where giant ‘owl block’ eats Mario, and sketched boss platform.
key_stories.outcome: Visual direction chosen; path and boss arena still pending; name "Oily Boily Bay" adopted provisionally.
key_stories.key_quote: This is his office building and this is like Bowser’s oil rig … Oily Boily Bay is so goofy, but it works.
